rules: Rule1: Either artwork1 is authentic to artist1, or artwork1 is a masterpiece.
Rule2: Provided that artwork1 was researched by scholar1, if it was documented in archive1, then it was published in catalog1.
Rule3: Under the condition that artwork1 was loaned to collector1, if it is exhibited at museum1, then it is a masterpiece.
Rule4: Either artwork1 was loaned to collector1, or it was acquired at auction1.
Rule5: Whenever artwork1 was purchased by buyer1, if it is exhibited at museum1, then it is a masterpiece.
Rule6: Either artwork1 was forged, or if it was acquired at auction1, then it was purchased by buyer1.
Rule7: If artwork1 was produced in period1, then it is not authentic to artist1.
Rule8: Provided that artwork1 was restored by conservator1, it was devalued.
Rule9: Either artwork1 was restored by conservator1, or it was damaged, or if it is not a masterpiece, then it is valuable.
Rule10: If artwork1 was conserved by fund1, then it was not devalued.
Rule11: In case artwork1 was preserved by trust1, it was not devalued.
Rule12: Either conservation_project1 was funded by grant1, or it was sponsored by donor1.
Rule13: Should conservation_project1 be sponsored by donor1, then either artwork1 was conserved by fund1, or it was preserved by trust1.
Rule14: Under the condition that grant1 was approved by committee1, if conservation_project1 was funded by grant1, then either artwork1 was conserved by fund1, or it was preserved by trust1.
Rule15: If artwork1 was authenticated by expert1, then it was produced in period1.
Rule16: Either artwork1 was authenticated by expert1, or it was dated using carbon_dating.
Rule17: If materials of artwork1 were researched by lab1, then its pigments were analyzed using spectrometer1.

Rule18: Under the condition that project1 was funded by institute1, if pigments of artwork1 were analyzed using spectrometer1, then if it is not the case that if it was appraised by appraiser1 then it is valuable, it was published in catalog1.

Rule19: In case project1 was sponsored by foundation1, if pigments of artwork1 were analyzed using spectrometer1, then if it is not the case that if it was appraised by appraiser1 then it is valuable, it was published in catalog1.
Rule20: If artwork1 has conflicting results, then it has conclusive analysis.
Rule21: Should artwork1 have conflicting results, then it does not have conclusive analysis.
Rule22: Provided that artwork1 was dated using carbon_dating, its provenance was verified by gallery1.
Rule23: Whenever provenance of artwork1 was verified by gallery1, it was produced in period1.
Rule24: In case artwork1 is insured under policy1, it was appraised by appraiser1.
Rule25: If it is not the case that if artwork1 is fake then it is not authentic to artist1, then it is disputed.
Rule26: Provided that it is not the case that either artwork1 was certified by board1, or it is an authenticated copy, or it is not disputed, then it was withdrawn.
Rule27: If it is not the case that either project1 was funded by institute1, or it was sponsored by foundation1, then artwork1 has conflicting results.
Rule28: Under the condition that it is not the case that if artwork1 was appraised by appraiser1 then it is valuable, it was documented in archive1.
Rule29: If it is not the case that if artwork1 was appraised by appraiser1 then it is valuable, then it was not published in catalog1.
Rule30: Provided that artwork1 is not a masterpiece, it is insured under policy1.
Rule31: Should artwork1 not be a masterpiece, then it is not valuable.
facts: Fact1: The artwork1 was researched by scholar1.
Fact2: The artwork1 was exhibited at museum1.
Fact4: The grant1 was approved by committee1.
Fact5: The materials of artwork1 were researched by lab1.
Fact6: It is not the case that artwork1 was forged.
Fact7: It is not the case that artwork1 is an authenticated copy.
Fact8: It is not the case that artwork1 was certified by board1.
Fact9: It is not the case that artwork1 was withdrawn.
Fact10: It is not the case that artwork1 was damaged.
